===Software counterfeits===

===Software "counterfeits"===
Several games in the Humble Indie Bundles have been released as open-source software as a result of the Bundles reaching certain sales levels. One such game was Wolfire's own ''Lugaru HD'', where they released the engine under the [[GNU General Public License]], and also included the various art assets, level designs, and other creative elements under a freely redistributable license.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://blog.wolfire.com/2010/05/Lugaru-goes-open-source | title = Lugaru goes open-source | first = David | last = Rosen | date = 2010-05-11 | accessdate = 2011-02-03 | publisher = [[Wolfire Games]] }}</ref> Their intent was to allow programmers to experiment and improve the game's engine using the associated assets.<ref name="wolfire counterfeit">{{cite web | url = http://blog.wolfire.com/2011/02/Counterfeit-Lugaru-on-Apple-s-App-Store-developing | title = Counterfeit Lugaru on Apple's App Store (developing) | first = Jeffery | last = Rosen | date = 2011-02-03 | accessdate = 2011-02-03 | publisher = [[Wolfire Games]] }}</ref> Wolfire later began selling the title ''Lugaru HD'' on the Mac App Store for $9.99. However, some time afterwards, another company, iCoder, used the open-source resources to recreate the same game for the App Store, charging only $0.99 for their version ''Lugaru''. iCoder claims they have the right to recreate and charge for the game under the GNU license, but Jeffery Rosen notes that this did not apply to the art assets.<ref name="wolfire counterfeit"/><ref>{{Cite web | url = http://kotaku.com/5750238/the-case-of-the-identical-rabbit-games | title = The Case Of The Identical Rabbit Games | first = Stephan | last = Tolito | date = 2011-02-02 | accessdate = 2011-02-03 | publisher = [[Kotaku]] }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/2011-02-03-humble-indie-bundle-dev-suffers-illegal-game-cloning | title = Humble Indie Bundle dev suffers "illegal" game cloning | date = 2011-02-03 | accessdate = 2011-02-03 | first = Alec | last = Meer | publisher = [[GamesIndustry.biz]] }}</ref> Also, the GPL license is not compatible with Apple's AppStore<ref>http://www.fsf.org/blogs/licensing/more-about-the-app-store-gpl-enforcement</ref> The iCoder version was taken down from the App Store after about a week since Wolfire notified them of the issue, though so far no explanation has been given by Apple.<ref name="wolfire counterfeit resolved">{{Cite web | url = http://twitter.com/humble/status/34771005364772864 | title = It looks like Apple has removed the counterfeit Lugaru from the Mac App Store after >1 week! | date = 2011-02-08 | accessdate = 2011-02-08 | first = Jeffrey | last = Rosen }}</ref> As the iCoder version of the application was popular, being the 60th most downloaded game application prior to its removal, Wolfire offered those that purchased the iCoder version a free version of their version and codes to unlock the game from within Steam.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.gamasutra.com/view/news/32966/Apple_Pulls_Counterfeit_Lugaru_From_Mac_App_Store.php | title = Apple Pulls Counterfeit Lugaru From Mac App Store | first = Eric | last = Caolli | date = 2011-02-10 | accessdate = 2011-02-10 | publisher = [[Gamasutra]] }}</ref>
